tn.text: The non-Jewish people offer to help build the temple.
This can be translated in active form. AT: "whom the Babylonians had taken into exile" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
man's name. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:02:01|2:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
He ruled in Assyria before Cyrus ruled in Persia. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
man's name. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:02:03|2:06]].

tn.ref: It is not you, but we who must build
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) the Jewish leader felt that Cyrus had authorized only them to build the temple or 2) building the temple was the exclusive work of the Jews and no non-Jew would be permitted to contribute to the work.
"the people who were living in the land at that time," which could include non-Jews and Jews whose families the Babylonians had not taken into exile
discouraged the Judeans (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] )
people who returned from Babylon and settled in the land of Judah
"to make it so the Judeans could not build the temple as they had planned"

tn.ref: wrote an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem
tn.text: The abstract nouns "accusation" can be translated as a verb "accuse" and the verb "live in," respectively. You may need to make explicit what the enemies accused the Judeans of doing. AT: "wrote a letter in which they accused those who lived in Judah and Jerusalem of disobeying the king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
names of men (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the letter spoken of in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:04:04|4:6]].
the language used in that area at the time for official business
into Persian
man's name. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:02:01]].
names of cities (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
name of a large region of land (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is a name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of the province that was west of the Euphrates River. It was across the river from the city of Susa. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Ezra includes in his writing the content of the letter sent to King Artaxerxes.

This is the name of the province that was west of the Euphrates River. It was across the river from the city of Susa. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:04:09|4:10]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The city is a metonym for the people who live in it. AT: "a city that they plan to live in and rebel against you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"fixed the foundations" or "mended the foundations"

tn.ref: if this city is built and the wall is completed
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "if they build the city and complete the wall" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: but they will harm the kings
tn.text: The word "harm" refers to the Judeans no longer giving money to the kings.

tn.ref: we have eaten the palace salt
tn.text: Possible meanings are that this refers to 1) the writers being loyal to the king (UDB) or 2) the king giving the writers special honors. AT: "we are loyal to you" or "you have honored us by making us your officials" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The city is a metonym for the people who live in it. AT: "a city in which live people who have rebelled against your father" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

This can be translated in active form, in which case you will need to make explicit who destroyed the city. AT: "the Babylonians destroyed the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: if this city and wall are built
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "if they build the city and wall" Similar words appear in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:04:13|4:13]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: there will be nothing remaining for you
tn.text: This is an exaggeration to make the king think that he will be losing much tax money if the Judeans rebel. (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

This is the name of the province that was west of the Euphrates River. It was across the river from the city of Susa. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:04:09|4:10]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

This is the name of the province that was west of the Euphrates River. It was across the river from the city of Susa. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:04:09|4:10]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: The letter that you sent me has been translated and read
tn.text: This can be translated in active form, in which case you will need to make explicit who translated and read the letter to the king. AT: "I have had my servants translate and read the letter that you sent to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
man's name. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:02:01|2:2]].
man's name. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:04:07|4:8]].
the Euphrates River

This is the name of the province that was west of the Euphrates River. It was across the river from the city of Susa. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:04:09|4:10]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Tribute and taxes were paid to them
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "The people in Jerusalem paid tribute and taxes to those kings" or "Those kings were able to collect tribute and taxes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"make a law"

tn.ref: Be careful not to neglect this
tn.text: "Be careful to do this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

tn.ref: Why allow this threat to grow and cause more loss for the royal interests?
tn.text: Artaxerxes uses a question to tell them that he understands that he will lose taxes and honor if the city is built. AT: "You must make sure that this threat does not grow and cause more loss for the royal interests." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Danger is spoken of as if it were a plant that could increase in size. AT: "danger to become worse" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: cause more loss for the royal interests
tn.text: The words "the royal interests" are a metonym for the king himself. AT: "cause more bad things to happen to the kings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

This can be translated in active form, in which case you will need to make explicit who read the decree from the king to the officials. AT: "The messengers from King Artaxerxes read his decree" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:02:01]].
Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:04:07]].

tn.ref: the work on the house of God in Jerusalem stopped until the second year of the reign of Darius
tn.text: This delay lasted about 16 years.
